Compute overall power for power analysis (C++)

compute_power_plan_overall_cpp.Rd

C++ implementation of compute_power_plan_overall that provides significant performance improvements for power analysis computations. Uses random effect sizes format with avg_fold_change and avg_fold_change_sq columns.

Usage

compute_power_plan_overall_cpp(
  fc_expression_df,
  library_size,
  num_trt_cells,
  num_cntrl_cells,
  multiple_testing_alpha = 0.05,
  multiple_testing_method = "BH",
  side = "left",
  prop_non_null = 0.1,
  return_full_results = FALSE
)

Arguments

fc_expression_df

DataFrame with fold change and expression info. Must contain:

  • relative_expression: Relative expression levels

  • expression_size: Size parameters for negative binomial distribution

  • avg_fold_change: Average fold change across perturbations

  • avg_fold_change_sq: Average of squared fold changes (second moment)

library_size

Numeric. Effective library size

num_trt_cells

Numeric. Number of treatment cells

num_cntrl_cells

Numeric. Number of control cells

multiple_testing_alpha

Numeric. FDR target level (default 0.05)

multiple_testing_method

String. Method ("BH" only supported)

side

String. Test sidedness ("left", "right", "both")

prop_non_null

Numeric. Proportion of non-null hypotheses (default 0.1)

return_full_results

Logical. Return full results or just overall power

Value

Numeric overall power (if return_full_results=FALSE) or List with full results

Details

This C++ implementation uses optimized C++ functions for random effect sizes:

  • compute_monte_carlo_teststat_cpp(): Monte Carlo test statistics for random effect sizes

  • compute_BH_plan(): Benjamini-Hochberg significance cutoff

  • rejection_computation_cpp(): Power calculations

The function provides identical results to the R version while offering significant performance improvements by eliminating R function call overhead.

See also

compute_power_plan_overall for R version
